# .NET Framework Performance

> Documentation for .NET Framework Performance.

- [Application Domain Resource Monitoring (ARM) ETW Events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/application-domain-resource-monitoring-arm-etw-events.md): Read about application domain resource monitoring (ARM) ETW events in .NET, such as ThreadCreated, AppDomainMemAllocated, AppDomainMemSurvived, and more.
- [Caching in .NET Framework Applications](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/caching-in-net-framework-applications.md): Use caching in .NET applications. Read about caching data, caching in ASP.NET applications or WCF REST services, and extending caching in .NET.
- [CLR ETW Events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/clr-etw-events.md): See articles about common language runtime (CLR) event tracing for Windows (ETW) events. There are two event providers: runtime provider and rundown provider.
- [CLR ETW Keywords and Levels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/clr-etw-keywords-and-levels.md): Review common language runtime (CLR) event tracing for Windows (ETW) keywords and levels. Event CLR ETW keywords enable the filtering of events by category.
- [CLR ETW Providers](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/clr-etw-providers.md): Review details about the two common language runtime (CLR) event tracing for Windows (ETW) providers: the runtime provider and the rundown provider.
- [Constrained Execution Regions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/constrained-execution-regions.md): Get started with constrained execution regions (CER), which are part of a mechanism for authoring reliable managed code.
- [Contention ETW events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/contention-etw-events.md): Get details about contention ETW events, which are raised whenever there's contention for System.Threading.Monitor locks or native locks used by the runtime.
- [Controlling .NET Framework Logging](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/controlling-logging.md): Use event tracing for Windows (ETW) to control .NET logging and record common language runtime (CLR) events. Use tools such as Logman, Tracerpt, and Xperf.
- [ETW Events in Task Parallel Library and PLINQ](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/etw-events-in-task-parallel-library-and-plinq.md): Read about ETW events in the Task Parallel Library and PLINQ. Use these events to profile and troubleshoot applications.
- [ETW Events in the Common Language Runtime](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/etw-events-in-the-common-language-runtime.md): Read a summary and view links concerning event tracing for Windows (ETW) events in the common language runtime (CLR).
- [ETW Events in the .NET Framework](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/etw-events.md): See article links about event tracing for Windows (ETW) in .NET. ETW is a high-performance, low-overhead, scalable tracing system.
- [Exception Thrown_V1 ETW Event](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/exception-thrown-v1-etw-event.md): View detailed information about the ExceptionThrown_V1 ETW event. Event data such as field names, data types, and descriptions are given for thrown exceptions.
- [Garbage Collection ETW Events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/garbage-collection-etw-events.md): View detailed information about garbage collection ETW events. The events covered include GCStart_V1, GCEnd_V1, GCHeapStats_V1, GCCreateSegment_V1, and more.
- [How to: Perform Lazy Initialization of Objects](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/how-to-perform-lazy-initialization-of-objects.md): See how to perform lazy initialization of objects using the System.Lazy<T> class. Lazy initialization means objects aren't created if they're never needed.
- [.NET Framework Performance](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/index.md): Design and plan for performance in your .NET apps. Use the tools provided by Microsoft to measure your app's performance and make improvements.
- [Interop ETW Events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/interop-etw-events.md): Review interop ETW (event tracing for Windows) events, which capture information about common intermediate language (CIL) stub generation & caching in .NET.
- [JIT Tracing ETW Events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/jit-tracing-etw-events.md): Understand just-in-time (JIT) tracing ETW events. These events collect information relating to the success or failure of JIT inlining and JIT tail calls.
- [Lazy Initialization](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/lazy-initialization.md): Explore lazy initialization in .NET, a performance improvement that means an object creation is deferred until the object is first used.
- [Loader ETW Events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/loader-etw-events.md): Review loader ETW events, which include application domain events, CLR loader assembly events, module events, CLR domain module events, and module range events.
- [Method ETW Events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/method-etw-events.md): See ETW events that collect information specific to methods, like CLR method events, CLR method marker or CLR method verbose events, and MethodJittingStarted.
- [.NET Performance Tips](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/performance-tips.md): Explore performance tips to improve the execution speed of a program in .NET. See tips for boxing and unboxing, strings, and finalizers.
- [Reliability Best Practices](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/reliability-best-practices.md): See best practices for reliability in .NET host-based server applications, such as SQL Server. Prevent them from leaking resources or getting brought down.
- [Reliability](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/reliability.md): Understand reliability in .NET. Protect against asynchronous exceptions in hosts executing in .NET, such as SQL Server.
- [Runtime Information ETW Events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/runtime-information-etw-events.md): See runtime information ETW events, which record the SKU, version number, how the runtime was activated (including command-line parameters), the GUID, and more.
- [Security ETW Events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/security-etw-events.md): Understand security ETW events, which are raised during strong name verification and Authenticode verification in .NET.
- [SQL Server Programming and Host Protection Attributes](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/sql-server-programming-and-host-protection-attributes.md): Get started with SQL Server programming and host protection attributes. Review SQL Server permission sets and programming model restrictions.
- [Stack ETW Event](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/stack-etw-event.md): Read about the stack ETW event, which should be used in conjunction with other events to generate stack traces after an event is raised.
- [Thread Pool ETW Events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/thread-pool-etw-events.md): Review thread pool ETW events, which collect information about threads in .NET. Thread pool events are worker thread pool events or I/O thread pool events.
- [Writing Large, Responsive .NET Framework Apps](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/framework/performance/writing-large-responsive-apps.md): Write large, responsive .NET apps, or apps that process a large amount of data, such as files or databases.
